intro: Protium reticulatum, commonly known as the net-veined sandarac tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and a distinctive, aromatic resin that has been historically used in traditional medicine and incense. Its bark and leaves contain compounds with potential medicinal properties. The tree thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests.
